item.title: Cancel Culture Comes for Artists Who Posted About Charlie Kirk’s Death
item.description: A “South Park” episode was taken off air, a DC comic series was canceled, and several artists were fired in the aftermath of the shooting.

item.title: Scientists Are Flocking to Bluesky
item.description: Academics once loved Twitter—but in the age of X they’ve abandoned it in droves.

item.title: Scientists Are Flocking to Bluesky

item.title: Bluesky now platform of choice for science community
item.description: It’s not just you. Survey says: “Twitter sucks now and all the cool kids are moving to Bluesky”

item.title: Bluesky Goes Dark in Mississippi Over Age Verification Law
item.description: Bluesky has chosen to block access in the state rather than risk potential fines of up to $10,000 per violation.

item.title: Kickback Soccer Media Aims to Become Central Hub for Soccer Conversations
item.description: Soccer is one of the most popular sports in the world, but is still grappling to get traction in the U.S. A group of entrepreneurs aims to change the playing field for the sport with the launch of Kic
